properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Flood Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: A State of Local Emergency has been declared in the Town of Peace River due to water overflowing Pat’s Creek Culvert. A number of roads have been impacted in the area of 100 Avenue and 100 Street. ### Visit https://peaceriver.ca/flooding-in-downtown/ for updates.
Expires: 2020-04-25T23:18:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Town of Peace River, 2020-04-18T23:17:49-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6314
Area: Peace #135
properties.Author: Town of Peace River

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Flood Advisory Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: A Flood Advisory has now been issued by the Alberta River Forecast Centre for Lac Ste. Anne County. Rapid snow melt has resulted in a very rapid rise in the water levels of both the Little Paddle and Paddle Rivers. Paddle River dykes are over topping in areas. This is in addition to the Spring Runoff Advisory for overland flooding in other areas of Lac Ste. Anne County. ### Residents and the travelling public may encounter high water levels in roadside ditches, and water encroaching or crossing roadways. The County has been actively steaming blocked culverts, and continues to respond to other areas of concern, to assist in the release of water to reduce hazardous conditions and prevent damage to roadway infrastructure as quickly as possible. Residents along the Little Paddle and Paddle Rivers will see additional overland flooding of low lying areas as large amounts of snow still remains in the western and northern portions of these river basins. Agricultural operations should consider moving livestock and equipment to higher ground at this time.
Expires: 2020-04-25T14:50:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Lac Ste. Anne County, 2020-04-18T14:48:52-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6313
Area: Lac Ste. Anne County
properties.Author: Lac Ste. Anne County

properties.Title: Flash Freeze Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Precipitation falling as rain will change over to snow this morning. Temperatures are expected to drop quickly during this transition. Water accumulation and wet snow will freeze as temperatures drop. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T15:59:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T12:21:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2322035535.2020
Area: Ville-Marie area, Témiscaming area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update - Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued By La Plonge Reserve
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for La Plonge. This advisory has been extended, and is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the La Plonge water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-04-25T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-04-18T13:34:18-06:00, 8D608BA5-EDD0-5047-9C66-ADFAD459011D
Area: La Plonge Reserve
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and strong winds expected tonight into Sunday. Total snowfall: 5 to 10 cm and possibly higher. Maximum wind gusts: 70 to 80 km/h. Time span: tonight to Sunday afternoon. Remarks: A low pressure system south of Nova Scotia will rapidly intensify as it tracks south of Cape Breton on Sunday. Snow and strong gusty winds can be expected with this system. Snow is forecast to begin tonight and end Sunday afternoon. There is still uncertainty with the track of the system which will affect the snowfall accumulations. If the track is closer to shore then snowfall amounts could be greater and warnings may be required. Winter storm warnings and snowfall warnings are in effect for most of Cape Breton. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T17:11:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T01:12:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3089715152.2020
Area: Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall is expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm. Locations: Cartwright to Lodge Bay, and possibly as far inland as Crook's Lake. Time span: Sunday night through Monday. Remarks: Snow is expected to begin Sunday evening in the Mary's Harbour area and spread northward to Cartwright by midnight. The snow will taper off over most areas Monday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-19T17:48:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T01:49:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1031453158.2020
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Flash Freeze Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures are falling rapidly this morning. Ponding water, slush, and any falling precipitation will freeze as the temperature drops. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Flash freeze warnings are issued when a rapid drop in temperature is expected, that can cause water from rain or melted snow on streets and sidewalks to quickly freeze. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T17:26:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T08:27:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1132001786.2020
Area: Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Gogama - Foleyet, Kirkland Lake - Englehart, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional snowfall: 10 to 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 90 km/h. Locations: Cape Breton County and Richmond County. Time span: until this afternoon. Remarks: Snow and blowing snow should taper this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T22:59:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T13:43:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0841555518.2020
Area: Richmond County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: easterly 80 to 110 km/h, highest along exposed areas of the coast. Locations: eastern and southeastern Newfoundland. Time span: this afternoon and evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-20T05:12:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T13:13:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4210432701.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. Total rainfall: 20 to 30 mm except locally 50 mm or more over parts of the Burin and southern Avalon Peninsulas. Locations: Avalon and Burin Peninsulas. Time span: this afternoon through tonight. Remarks: Snow at times heavy will transition to heavy rain this afternoon. Near 15 cm of snowfall accumulation is expected before the changeover to rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-20T05:14:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T13:15:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2151577334.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Flood Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: After overnight flooding, there are roadblocks in place in the area of 100 Avenue and 100 Street and in the River Front Park area of downtown Peace River. ### Visit https://peaceriver.ca/flooding-in-downtown/ for updates. Crews are working to clean up and assess the area today. Traffic across Downtown is being routed along 101 Street from the Heart River Bridge to the roundabout.
Expires: 2020-04-26T09:26:13-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Town of Peace River, 2020-04-19T09:24:12-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6317
Area: Town of Peace River

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 25 to 30 cm is expected. Moisture streaming eastward across the northern Yukon is generating snow at times heavy over northern sections of the Dempster region. An additional 10 to 20 cm of snow is expected near the Richardson Mountains by Monday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-20T03:50:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T11:51:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0712170638.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Location: Guysborough County. Time Span: until late this afternoon. Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting to 90 km/h are expected along the coast until late this afternoon. These strong winds combined with falling snow may cause reduced visibilities in blowing snow over some locations. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-04-19T23:44:08-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: southern, eastern, northeastern and central Newfoundland as well as the Great Northern Peninsula. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm except 25 to 35 cm over the Baie Verte Peninsula. Time span: until this evening for southern and eastern Newfoundland. This afternoon to overnight for central and northeastern Newfoundland. This evening to Monday morning for the Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: The snow is forecast to change to rain over the Connaigre Peninsula and Bonavista and Clarenville this evening before ending. Rainfall amounts of 10 to 15 mm are possible. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-04-20T05:15:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-04-19T13:16:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0756339625.2020
Area: Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova, Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
